summary: Email exchange between attorney Jay Lefkowitz and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a planned meeting. Lefkowitz mentions he will be seeing Jeffrey Epstein during his trip and can update on civil cases, but primarily suggests a social visit. The AUSA asks if the meeting is purely social or if they need to discuss Epstein-related matters.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Attorney communicating with a U.S. Attorney about a planned meeting; mentions he will be seeing Jeffrey Epstein during his trip and can update on civil cases.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by Jay Lefkowitz as someone he will be seeing during his trip; subject of civil cases being discussed.

persons.name: Roy
persons.context: Mentioned by the Assistant U.S. Attorney as someone who will be included in an email on two issues related to Mr. Epstein.

connections.description: Lefkowitz indicates he will be seeing Epstein during his trip and is dealing with various civil cases related to him.
Email exchange regarding a planned meeting, with discussion of Epstein-related matters and a suggestion of a social visit.

events.title: Planned meeting between attorney and AUSA
events.description: Jay Lefkowitz and an Assistant U.S. Attorney plan to meet around Thanksgiving 2008; discussion includes whether the meeting is social or will involve Epstein-related matters.

keyFacts: Attorney Jay Lefkowitz was in communication with a U.S. Attorney about Jeffrey Epstein in November 2008.
Lefkowitz mentions he will be seeing Jeffrey Epstein during his trip and can update on civil cases involving Epstein.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney questions whether the planned meeting is purely social or if they need to discuss Epstein-related matters.
The email includes a confidentiality notice from Kirkland & Ellis LLP, indicating legal representation.
